method.markdown:
The following table describes all technical details of Use Case `UC8`:
Property Details
ID UC8
Signature _self install SuD
Primary Hoster
Actors
Brief "he just downloads the app (either as a TGZ archive of RPM package or Chef cookbook, or any of that) and installs it locally. Then he starts it as a Java standalone app, or Linux service, or something similar. And it works with a local collection of users and local docker installation"
Actors taking participation in the Use Case have the following properties:
Actor Properties
Hoster "a an owner of a web server, who wants to install Thindeck locally and host containers himself"

Actors taking participation in the Use Case have the following properties:

Actor Properties
Hoster "a an owner of a web server, who wants to install Thindeck locally and host containers himself"

method.markdown:
The following table describes all technical details of Use Case `UC1`:
Property Details
ID UC1
Signature user hosts repo
Primary User
Actors user as User; repo as Repository
Success Flow 1. user registers repo
2. repo deploys itself
3. user reads deployment logs using repo
4. user reads usage stats using repo
5. user compensates usage using repo
6. user terminates repo
Actors taking participation in the Use Case have the following properties:
Actor Properties
User "a person identified in the system (logged in)"
  • repo: Repository
  • URN: "a unique identifier of itself, for example urn:github:526301"
  • authTokens: "a list of auth tokens to each auth provider the user connected to, e.g., Goole, Facebook, etc."
  • balance: "amount of money available, can be stored as integer number of cents"
User "a person identified in the system (logged in)"
  • repo: Repository
  • URN: "a unique identifier of itself, for example urn:github:526301"
  • authTokens: "a list of auth tokens to each auth provider the user connected to, e.g., Goole, Facebook, etc."
  • balance: "amount of money available, can be stored as integer number of cents"
Repository "a storage of source code together with Dockerfile"
  • name: "a unique name of the repo in user's account"
  • URI: "a non-ambiguous descriptor of a repo, for example ssh://git@github:yegor256/thindeck.git"
  • key: "a private SSH key, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Public-key_cryptography"
  • deployment: Deployment

method.markdown:
The following table describes all technical details of Use Case `UC9`:
Property Details
ID UC9
Signature anonymous signs up
Primary Anonymous
Actors anonymous as Anonymous; user as User
Success Flow 1. anonymous "initiates sign in via one of auth providers, e.g., Facebook, Google+, etc."
2. system "requests permission from the OAuth provider chosen by the anonymous"
3. system creates user
4. system "adds $5 to the user.balance"
5. anonymous logs in
Actors taking participation in the Use Case have the following properties:
Actor Properties
Anonymous "a person who is not identified in the system (not logged in). He can actually have a User account in our System, but we can't tell it until he logs in"
Anonymous "a person who is not identified in the system (not logged in). He can actually have a User account in our System, but we can't tell it until he logs in"
User "a person identified in the system (logged in)"
  • repo: Repository
  • URN: "a unique identifier of itself, for example urn:github:526301"
  • authTokens: "a list of auth tokens to each auth provider the user connected to, e.g., Goole, Facebook, etc."
  • balance: "amount of money available, can be stored as integer number of cents"

method.markdown:
The following table describes all technical details of Use Case `UC2`:
Property Details
ID UC2
Signature _self registers
Primary User
Actors
Success Flow 1. user "enters a new unique name of the repository, its URI and an optional SSH key and confirms entered data"
2. system "adds the Repository and displays it in the list of other repositories in the user account"
Actors taking participation in the Use Case have the following properties:
Actor Properties
User "a person identified in the system (logged in)"
  • repo: Repository
  • URN: "a unique identifier of itself, for example urn:github:526301"
  • authTokens: "a list of auth tokens to each auth provider the user connected to, e.g., Goole, Facebook, etc."
  • balance: "amount of money available, can be stored as integer number of cents"

method.markdown:
The following table describes all technical details of Use Case `UC3`:
Property Details
ID UC3
Signature _self deploys itself
Primary Repository
Actors
Brief "We fetch the repository every five minutes and check the difference between existing source code and the latest version. If there are any changes, we stop its Docker container, and start a new one with the latest version of the source code. Besides Dockerfile, which is used for the Docker container, we should look for a Manifest of the repository. According to the informaiton in the Manifest we should configure the container after its start. While the repository is used, we should track its CPU and traffic consumption, and assign to its owner"
Actors taking participation in the Use Case have the following properties:
Actor Properties
Repository "a storage of source code together with Dockerfile"
  • name: "a unique name of the repo in user's account"
  • URI: "a non-ambiguous descriptor of a repo, for example ssh://git@github:yegor256/thindeck.git"
  • key: "a private SSH key, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Public-key_cryptography"
  • deployment: Deployment
method.html:
The following table describes all technical details of Use Case UC3:

Property Details
ID UC3
Signature _self deploys itself
Primary Repository
Actors
Brief "We fetch the repository every five minutes and check the difference between existing source code and the latest version. If there are any changes, we stop its Docker container, and start a new one with the latest version of the source code. Besides Dockerfile, which is used for the Docker container, we should look for a Manifest of the repository. According to the informaiton in the Manifest we should configure the container after its start. While the repository is used, we should track its CPU and traffic consumption, and assign to its owner"

Actors taking participation in the Use Case have the following properties:

Actor Properties
Repository "a storage of source code together with Dockerfile"
  • name: "a unique name of the repo in user's account"
  • URI: "a non-ambiguous descriptor of a repo, for example ssh://git@github:yegor256/thindeck.git"
  • key: "a private SSH key, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Public-key_cryptography"
  • deployment: Deployment

method.markdown:
The following table describes all technical details of Use Case `UC4`:
Property Details
ID UC4
Signature _self reads deployment logs using _arg0
Primary User
Actors _arg0 as Repository
Success Flow 1. user "requests a list of deployments for the Repository"
2. system "displays a list of deployments that has already been executed"
3. user "chooses a deployment and initiates viewing its log"
4. system "displays a log for the chosen deployment"
Actors taking participation in the Use Case have the following properties:

  • name: "a unique name of the repo in user's account"

  • key: "a private SSH key, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Public-key_cryptography"
  • deployment: Deployment

method.markdown:
The following table describes all technical details of Use Case `UC5`:
Property Details
ID UC5
Signature user reads usage stats using repo
Primary User
Actors user as User; repo as Repository
Success Flow 1. user "selects a time interval, like: last 7 days, last month, custom (from date, to date)"
2. system "reads usage records corresounding to the repo within specified time interval"
3. system "shows the user a table with these columns: Container (id), Inbound traffic (Gb), Outbound traffic (Gb), CPU time (min), Cost ($). Each table row corresponds to a container. Last row contains totals by all containers. The values in the table are usage stats by container within specified time interval"
Actors taking participation in the Use Case have the following properties:
Actor Properties
User "a person identified in the system (logged in)"
  • repo: Repository
  • URN: "a unique identifier of itself, for example urn:github:526301"
  • authTokens: "a list of auth tokens to each auth provider the user connected to, e.g., Goole, Facebook, etc."
  • balance: "amount of money available, can be stored as integer number of cents"
User "a person identified in the system (logged in)"
  • repo: Repository
  • URN: "a unique identifier of itself, for example urn:github:526301"
  • authTokens: "a list of auth tokens to each auth provider the user connected to, e.g., Goole, Facebook, etc."
  • balance: "amount of money available, can be stored as integer number of cents"
Repository "a storage of source code together with Dockerfile"
  • name: "a unique name of the repo in user's account"
  • URI: "a non-ambiguous descriptor of a repo, for example ssh://git@github:yegor256/thindeck.git"
  • key: "a private SSH key, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Public-key_cryptography"
  • deployment: Deployment

ID UC6
Signature _self compensates usage using _arg0
Primary User
Actors _arg0 as Repository
Brief "The user adds funds to his account, when it goes to a negative value. Funds can be added through PayPal only"

method.markdown:
The following table describes all technical details of Use Case `UC7`:
Property Details
ID UC7
Signature _self terminates
Primary User
Actors
Brief "The user just removes the repository and we immediately terminate the Docker container, close all ports, and stops routing domain names. This operation is irrevertable"
Actors taking participation in the Use Case have the following properties:
Actor Properties
User "a person identified in the system (logged in)"
  • repo: Repository
  • URN: "a unique identifier of itself, for example urn:github:526301"
  • authTokens: "a list of auth tokens to each auth provider the user connected to, e.g., Goole, Facebook, etc."
  • balance: "amount of money available, can be stored as integer number of cents"
